source_sentence: 娜　莫　三　曼　多　沒　馱(引)　喃(一)(上)　唵　薩嚩(轉舌)　禰(泥禮反)　嚩　多(引)　喃(引)(二)　翳　醯　曳(二合引)呬　阿(引)　儞(寧逸反)　底也(二合)　素　麼(四)　半左　諾　乞察(二合)　怛囉(二合)(五)　攞　護　計　都　娜嚩(二合)捺　捨　尾　麼　曩(六)　阿　瑟吒(二合)　尾孕(二合)設　底(丁以反)(七)　鉢哩(二合)　體(他以反)　吠　曳(二合入)摘　枳(經異反)　吽(引)　柞(入)　娑嚩(二合引)　賀(引)　復次明諸天　　大自在天印　慧羽五輪舒　　承頰儼然住　三昧舒五輪　　空持風上節　是大梵天契　　竪印念本明　定手獨為拳　　火舒風屈節　由如立戟相　　伊舍那天印　定慧堅固合　　雙建二空輪　竪立同於幢　　一切執曜印　不改前印相　　空火各相交　令指著手背　　是一切宿契　復說外界天　　祕密諸印相　伊舍已前明　　次述餘天印　東方持國主　　舉右手為拳　左覆自叉腰　　名為水護印　定慧內為拳　　水輪舒並竪　運動明音樂　　是乾闥婆契　定手仰當心　　火空相捻合　由如三角樣　　是契名火天　慧手竪四輪　　空橫於掌中　風屈三召之　　是召火天相　南門焰魔王　　其印如後明　二手合為蓮　　地風垂入掌　如同但拏相　　名曰死王標　復說西南方　　羅剎娑王印　定慧合蓮掌　　二水入月交　復次西龍方　　定慧內合拳　二風如環相　　是水諸龍契　定手握為拳　　地水如幢建　想彼幡搖動　　威怒護方隅　次北最勝方　　多聞天王契　三昧智慧手　　內合交指拳　二火合其峯　　蹙之如寶狀　是等諸天印　　結念招召之　令護道場人　　厄者皆滿願　召請大天訖　　次念彼緣起　偈句分明呼　　三遍或七遍　諸法從緣生　　如來說是因　此法因緣盡　　是大沙門說　十二緣生偈　　次第亦念之　書壇及稱念　　一一勿遺忘無明緣行行緣識。

Consciousness conditioned by name-and-form, name-and-form conditioned by the six sense-fields.
The six sense-fields conditioned by contact conditioned by sensation ...
sensation has the condition of feeling, craving has the condition of grasping.
Apprehension is conditioned by existence, and birth is conditioned by existence.
birth has the condition of aging and death and the condition of grief, sorrow, pain, and vexation.

source_sentence: 又書滅句即是十二緣滅。
translation: The phrase "written to cease" also refers to the twelve conditions for cessation.

source_sentence: 無明滅則行滅行滅則識滅。
translation: When nescience ceases, form ceases; when form ceases, consciousness ceases.

source_sentence: 識滅則名色滅名色滅則六入滅。
translation: When consciousness ceases, name-and-form ceases, and when name-and-form ceases, the six sense-fields cease.

source_sentence: 六入滅則觸滅觸滅則受滅。
translation: When the six sense-fields cease, touch ceases, and when touch ceases, sensation ceases.

source_sentence: 受滅則愛滅愛滅則取滅。
translation: When sensation ceases, craving ceases, and craving ceases, then apprehension ceases.

source_sentence: 取滅則有滅有滅則生滅。
translation: When appropriation ceases, existence ceases, and when existence ceases, birth ceases.

source_sentence: 生滅則老死憂悲苦惱滅。
translation: When birth ceases, old age and death, grief, sorrow, pain, and vexation cease.

source_sentence: 右於輪外一百八蓮華葉上。
translation: On the right, he places the one hundred and eight lotus leaves outside the wheel.
On each of the 108 lotus leaves, he writes the letter a in Sanskrit so that it's completely covered.
Whenever he recites it, he should make a vow to reveal it to the sages.
You should make a vow to reveal it to the sages.

source_sentence: 手捧香爐至誠處恭長跪。
translation: Hold a censer in your hand, stand at attention, and kneel down respectfully.

source_sentence: 向佛作如是言(此誓願文。
translation: He says this to the Buddha (This vow is made by the master of the site of enlightenment himself three times a day.

source_sentence: 須道場主每日三時自入啟願。
translation: The master of the site of enlightenment must enter the site himself three times a day to initiate the vow.
The person reciting it must also recite it himself so that it becomes ripe.

translation: He must always say this vow.) His disciple, Mr. *a (as he's known to laypeople, his name is...)

translation: If a minister or an official says, "Such and such is the name of an official.

source_sentence: 若國王云某國號主姓名)我今歸命佛法僧寶海會聖眾。
translation: If the king calls it a certain king's name, I now take refuge in the holy congregation of the Buddha, Dharma, Saṃgha, and Saṃgha treasures.

source_sentence: 仰啟清淨法身遍照如來。
translation: I hereby invoke the pure Dharma body of the Universally Shining Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 普告十方三世一切諸佛大菩薩眾。
translation: I universally address all the buddhas and great bodhisattva congregations of the ten directions and three times.
All good men, noble men, śrāvakas, and pratyekbuddhas.
The five supernormal celestials and nine grasping celestials.
The twelve palace masters and twenty-eight constellations.
The four great luminous kings of the noble spirits and gods.
The eight world-protecting gods and their retinues.
The good spirits of the land, mountains, and rivers who protect the Dharma.
The karmic destinies of the officials of hell and the stars of their original lives.

source_sentence: 我今遇此災難變(所求之願。
translation: Now, I've encountered these catastrophic circumstances (and have asked for each of these vows).
I'll explain them one by one.) I'd like to be asked to do something.
The great sky-wandering god wishes to obey the Buddha's commands.
Accepting my invitation, they'll all come to the meeting.
They'll simply come here and sincerely rejoice.

source_sentence: 為我某甲除滅如是急厄災難。
translation: Help me, Mr. A, to remove such urgent and dangerous calamities.

source_sentence: 我承大聖攝護慈力遇聞此教。
translation: I acknowledge the power of the great sage's compassionate protection when I encounter and hear this teaching.

source_sentence: 拔濟我等及一切有情輪迴苦業。
translation: It will rescue us and all sentient beings from the pain of transmigration.
May it be the wish of the nine appropriating celestials.
Relying on the wheel of Buddhism, change calamity into good fortune.
May they bestow on me fearlessness and make me live in well-being.
In the future, we'll be united with our fellow bodhisattvas.
Never abandoning craving and ill-will, we'll mutually benefit each other.

source_sentence: 願施無畏令我吉祥(已上願文每常須懃誦一日三時啟願勿絕也)每日三時或四時或長時。
translation: May bestowing fearlessness make me fortunate (the vow above should always be recited three times a day, so that the vow of inspiration doesn't end.) Three times a day, four times a day, or a long time.
He gives rise to the vow and prays to remove his inability to come to terms with it.

source_sentence: 若也因巡怠慢即所求無應。
translation: If he's also negligent because of his duties, then what he asks for won't be answered.
Those who are afflicted by trouble must make a vow with all their heart.
On the full day of the ceremony, he relies on the teaching of the true language.
He'll use butter, honey, cheese, milk, and wood to guard and moisten his body.

source_sentence: 及施八方天并施一切鬼神等食。
translation: He gives food to the gods in the eight directions and to all the spirits.
In a basin of water, he puts various sweet foods, fruits, and sweets.

translation: He puts various sweet foods, fruits, sweets, and crunchies in it.

translation: It must be broken into pieces, recited, and given in the true words of the burning mouth to arouse compassion.

source_sentence: 加持三七遍或七七遍或百八遍。
translation: He should recite it three or seven times, or seven or seven times, or one hundred or eight times.

source_sentence: 將施郭外或宅外瀉置於淨地。
translation: Place the offering outside the monastery or outside your home on a clean place.

source_sentence: 施與無名無位鬼神食之。
translation: He gives it to a nameless, statusless spirit to eat.

source_sentence: 或分瀉置江河長流水中。
translation: Or he might dispose of it by pouring it into the long, flowing water of a river.
Thus, the person follows the teaching.

source_sentence: 一切災難無不消滅除殄。
translation: None of the calamities will go away or be eliminated.

source_sentence: 時文殊師利菩薩告大眾言。
translation: Mañjuśrī addressed the crowd, saying.
"Ever since I heard this teaching, I've always explained it for sentient beings in this way.
I've always explained it to sentient beings in this way.
All tathāgatas will then realize me.
After I finish teaching the Dharma wheel that causes the removal of disasters.

source_sentence: 汝等諸天眾當如佛教敬順奉行。
translation: All of you gods will respect, obey, and practice the teaching just as it was taught.
It was then that the gods heard this sūtra and spoke about it.

source_sentence: 皆大歡喜異口同音咸作是言。
translation: They were all greatly elated, and they all spoke with one voice, saying.
"Respectfully relying on the noble teaching, we dare not transgress it.
They wholeheartedly accepted, handed down, paid homage, and departed.
